summary: The BIRD Energy and U.S.-Israel Energy Center Reauthorization Act of 2025 aims to expand and reauthorize the United States-Israel Energy Cooperation program. The bill extends funding for cooperative research and the Energy Center, increasing the authorized amounts and extending the authorization through 2031. It also adds new categories to the areas of energy cooperation, including hydrogen, fusion energy, industrial decarbonization, carbon management, agrivoltaics, grid modernization, and cybersecurity for energy infrastructure. Finally, it extends the reauthorization of the United States-Israel Energy Cooperation to 2035.
